page.title: 02THE FOREST WALL West Forres
page.content: On the {Darnaway Estate}there is a wall known as the {Forest Wall.}In the 1400s the land was owned by the crown. Today it is owned by the Earl of Moray .The king visited the area to hunt boar and red deer.The wall was built because people were moving into the area and the king wanted to keep his forest for hunting.The law said that no person could build and settle on enclosed land.So a wall was built of local river stones in a semi_circle starting from and returning to the { {River Findhorn.}If anyone moved on to the land they would be cruelly driven off.In the late 1500s Royal Hunts on the Darnaway Estate died out.Parts of the wall can still be seen today.
